required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Learn More About the Relationship Between the Development of a Gap in the Upper Lip (Cleft Lip) or in the Roof of the Mouth (Cleft Palate) in Newborns and the Use of Glucocorticoids by the Mother During Pregnancy: a Meta-analysis
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Association of Orofacial Cleft and Glucocorticoids Exposure During Pregnancy: a Meta-analysis

brief_summary.textblock: Glucocorticoids are drugs that have many effects on body metabolism, raise sugar level in the blood, and reduce inflammation. By applying a statistical technique for combining the findings from a systematic literature review (meta analysis), researchers want to learn more about the relationship of the risk to develop a separation in the roof of the mouth (cleft palate) in newborns and contact with glucocorticoids during pregnancy.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of any type of orofacial cleft
primary_outcome.description: Meta-analysis will be conducted with 18 observational studies. Oral clefts are defined as diagnosis of cleft lip with or without cleft palate or isolated cleft palate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Potency (mild, moderate, potent, very potent) of glucocorticosteroids
secondary_outcome.description: Potency of glucocorticoid Mild Moderate Potent Very potent
Route of administration: Topical Systemic Any other form of use
Types of orofacial cleft Cleft lip (CP) Cleft lip with or without palate (CLP) Cleft palate (CP) Orofacial cleft (OC)

clinical_study.condition: Relationship Between the Exposure of Glucocorticoids During Pregnancy and Orofacial Cleft Development

arm_group.description: Pregnant women exposed to any glucocorticoid or corticosteroid or steroids in early pregnancy or first trimester of pregnancy
Women not using any glucocorticoid or corticosteroid or steroids during pregnancy

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women exposed to any glucocorticoid or corticosteroid or steroids in early pregnancy or first trimester of pregnancy irrespective of mode of administration identified through a systematic review of articles published up to 25 June 2018 by pre-specified inclusion and exclusion criteria. In total 18 observational studies have been selected for this meta-analysis with sample size for individual studies ranging from 106 to 832,636 patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Population: Pregnant women
- Intervention: Any glucocorticoid or corticosteroid or steroids use irrespective of mode of administration
- Comparator: Any/none
- Outcomes: Incidence/ risk of cleft lip/palate in infants
- Study Design:
- Meta-analysis and systematic literature reviews
- Observational studies (such as cohort study, case-control study, registries data)
- Clinical trials - Phase IIb, III, and IV
- Conference abstracts/posters
- Time period: No time period restriction
- Geography: No geography restriction
Exclusion Criteria:
- Population: Nonpregnant women
- Intervention: Drugs other than glucocorticoid or corticosteroid or steroid
- Outcomes: Incidence/ risk of cleft lip/palate in infants
- Study Design:
- Animal Study
- In vitro studies
- Editorial, letters, comment
- Clinical trials - Phase I or preclinical
- Case reports, case series
- Reviews
- Studies focusing on:
- Diagnosis and surgical procedure for cleft repair
- Impact of Increased internal corticosteroids due to stress
- The relationship between genetic mutations and cleft patients
- Adverse events for other drugs
- Safety profiles of glucocorticoid or corticosteroid
